bayonetta.deck: Bayonetta is a "stylish action game" from PlatinumGames.  The titular character is a witch who can use hair-based magic, as well as firearms attached to her feet, to battle fallen angels and other foes.
bayonetta.name: Bayonetta

bayonetta.deck: A retro style game featuring Bayonetta.
bayonetta.name: 8-Bit Bayonetta

bayonetta.deck: The sequel to the critically-acclaimed spectacle brawler Bayonetta, this time with a two-player online co-op mode and exclusive to the Nintendo Wii U.
bayonetta.name: Bayonetta 2

bayonetta.deck: The third entry in the Bayonetta series comes to Nintendo Switch.
bayonetta.name: Bayonetta 3

mario.deck: The series' debut on the Switch heralds the return of "Story Mode" for the first time since Power Tour on the Game Boy Advance.
mario.name: Mario Tennis Aces

mario.deck: When Prism Island turns into a gray, drained landscape, it's up to paper Mario to restore its natural hues in this paint-themed entry to the Paper Mario series.
mario.name: Paper Mario: Color Splash

mario.deck: Two Mario-themed role-playing game series collide in one bizarre crossover adventure!
mario.name: Mario & Luigi: Paper Jam

mario.deck: Dr. Mario: Miracle Cure for Nintendo 3DS features various new modes, book-mode style touch screen gameplay and online play.
mario.name: Dr. Mario: Miracle Cure

mario.deck: Mario Kart returns and makes its HD-debut with gravity-defying hover vehicles, a new spin on the traditional track designs, ATVs, the return of classic Last Man Standing-Battle Mode, custom online tournaments and Mario Kart TV, which allows for sharing of highlight videos online.
mario.name: Mario Kart 8

mario.deck: A free expanded version of the AR-app on the Nintendo 3DS available on the eShop.
mario.name: Photos with Mario

mario.deck: The fourth entry in the Mario and Luigi RPG series has Mario traversing dreams within Luigi's mind. Players will have to interact with Luigi on the bottom screen to provoke certain events within his dreams.
mario.name: Mario & Luigi: Dream Team

mario.deck: A handheld RPG and the fourth in the Paper Mario series. Along with the signature papercraft aesthetic, the game uses stickers as a core mechanic in both story and gameplay.
mario.name: Paper Mario: Sticker Star

mario.deck: A remake of the original Mario & Luigi RPG with an additional, parallel side-story.
mario.name: Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga + Bowser's Minions

mario.deck: Mario Tennis Open for the 3DS is the sixth game in the Mario Tennis series. It was announced during Nintendo's pre-TGS Media Briefing on September 12, 2011.
mario.name: Mario Tennis Open

mario.deck: Super Mario 3D Land blends elements of 2D and 3D Mario platformers, making it distinct from both parts of the franchise.
mario.name: Super Mario 3D Land

mario.deck: Six-player arcade game machine.
mario.name: Mario Party Fushigi no Challenge World

mario.deck: The first stereoscopic 3D edition of the premiere Kart Racing series starring Nintendo's famous mascots and the seventh home release in the franchise (ninth overall). It has a new first-person mode and kart customizations.
mario.name: Mario Kart 7

mario.deck: A remake of Mario and Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story, with an additional story mode featuring Bowser Jr.
mario.name: Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story + Bowser Jr.'s Journey

mario.deck: Mario, Luigi and the rest of the cast return for their HD debut in New Super Mario Bros. U with support for five players in boost mode, a Super Mario World-style world map with secret shortcuts and hidden levels, a brand new challenge mode and Miiverse integration.
mario.name: New Super Mario Bros. U

mario.deck: The third and latest entry in the Namco Bandai-developed Mario Kart Arcade franchise, released exclusively in Japan.
mario.name: Mario Kart: Arcade GP DX

mario.deck: The first Mario sequel in over 15 years to appear on the same console as its predecessor, Mario is back in the galactic platforming game, joined by Yoshi as he explores additional planets with new mechanics, power-ups, and boss battles.
mario.name: Super Mario Galaxy 2

mario.deck: DSi edition of DR. Mario.
mario.name: Dr. Mario Express

mario.deck: Minis on the Move is the first entry of the puzzle-oriented Mario vs DK series on the Nintendo 3DS.
mario.name: Mario and Donkey Kong: Minis on the Move

mario.deck: Fill your prescription with this WiiWare update of Nintendo's pill-popping puzzle game.
mario.name: Dr. Mario Online RX

mario.deck: Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story is the third installment in the whimsical Mario & Luigi franchise by AlphaDream & Nintendo. Mario and Luigi must save the Mushroom Kingdom from the evil doings of Fawful, with the unknowing help of King Bowser.
mario.name: Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story

mario.deck: In Mario's first Wii adventure, the famed plumber travels throughout the universe on his latest quest to save Princess Peach from the evil Bowser.
mario.name: Super Mario Galaxy

mario.deck: Developed by Next Level Games for Nintendo, Mario Strikers Charged is a football game involving classic Nintendo characters released for the Wii. It also introduces online play into the Mario Strikers series.
mario.name: Mario Strikers Charged

mario.deck: Mario Kart Arcade GP is a version of Mario Kart for arcades, featuring the ability to save progress to a card and unlock items and new cars, along with a camera of taking a picture of yourself in the game.
mario.name: Mario Kart Arcade GP

mario.deck: Control a cadre of Mario miniatures to battle Mario's nemesis, Donkey Kong. It's more focused on creating a path this time.
mario.name: Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Mini-Land Mayhem

mario.deck: Mario takes it to the soccer field in Super Mario Strikers. Use Koopa shells and Super Strikes to crush your opponent! (Literally.)
mario.name: Super Mario Strikers

mario.deck: Released in 2005, Power Tour is a fantasy take on the classic sport.
mario.name: Mario Tennis: Power Tour

mario.deck: Mario Power Tennis is a casual tennis game for the GameCube.  It introduced power shots to the Mario Tennis franchise.
mario.name: Mario Power Tennis

mario.deck: The second arcade Mario Kart title. Both Waluigi and Mametchi join the roster in this racer.
mario.name: Mario Kart Arcade GP 2

mario.deck: A pinball game starring Mario.
mario.name: Mario Pinball Land

mari.deck: MegaMari is a Megaman-styled Japanese doujin game starring characters from the popular Touhou series.  You control two characters, Marisa and Alice, and can freely switch between them during stages, each having a different set of weapon powerups.
mari.name: MegaMari

mari.deck: Adult Rock-Paper-Scissors type game developed by Enix in 1983.
mari.name: Mari-chan Kikiippatsu

call.deck: The Call of Duty release for 2018 ditches a traditional single-player campaign in favor of an expanded zombies mode and a battle royale mode known as Blackout.
call.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops 4

call.deck: An upcoming game in the Call of Cthulhu franchise from Cyanide Studio and Focus Home Interactive.
call.name: Call of Cthulhu - The Video Game

call.deck: Call of Duty's 2017 release returns to its World War II roots.
call.name: Call of Duty: WWII

call.deck: Set in futuristic 2080, the 13th entry of the Call of Duty series brings a war that spans our entire Solar System.
call.name: Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare

call.deck: Set 40 years after the events of Black Ops II, the twelfth installment of the Call of Duty series brings advanced robotics and biotic augmentations to the clandestine operations of the Black Ops storyline.
call.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops III

call.deck: The Black Ops storyline continues, switching the past Cold War from the game's predecessor to future 2025, as a new Cold War between U.S.A. and China flares up due to the actions of one vengeful drug-runner.
call.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops II

call.deck: The last installment of the Modern Warfare trilogy brings World War 3 to the world of Call of Duty. While the U.S., British, and French armed forces try to push back the Russian invasion, the disavowed Task Force 141 begin their hunt for international terrorist Vladimir Makarov.
call.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3

call.deck: The seventh installment of the long-running action franchise, Call of Duty: Black Ops puts players into the early era of the Cold War (including the Vietnam War) as a member of the United States black operations unit known as the SOG.
call.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops

call.deck: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.:Call Of Pripyat ( ) is the third game in the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. franchise, and picks up shortly after the events of the original game. Call of Pripyat takes elements from both the original game and the prequel, Clear Sky, and is generally considered the most polished and most accessible game in the series.
call.name: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat

call.deck: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare: Mobilized is the Nintendo DS version of Infinity Ward's game Modern Warfare 2.
call.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare: Mobilized

call.deck: Treyarch ports Infinity Ward's insanely popular shooter Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare to the Nintendo Wii, adding Wiimote aiming and motion controls to the game, as well as co-op play.
call.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Reflex Edition

call.deck: Join Ray McCall and his brother Thomas on a quest for gold, lust, and greed.
call.name: Call of Juarez: Bound in Blood

call.deck: Treyarch takes the famous series back sixty years, with the first Call of Duty game set in the Pacific Theatre, against the Imperial Japanese in World War II.
call.name: Call of Duty: World at War

call.deck: The first entry in the critically-acclaimed military first-person shooter series, Call of Duty puts players in the boots of three Allied soldiers in three different campaigns of World War II.
call.name: Call of Duty

call.deck: Call to Power 2 is a civilization clone released by Activison in 2000. It is the sequel to Civilization: Call to Power
call.name: Call to Power II

call.deck: A game combining a remake of detective visual novel Mystereet: Fukagyaku Sekai no Tantei Shinshi and the brand new sequel Mystereet 2: Farewell Encounter.
call.name: Mystereet F: Tantei-tachi no Curtain Call

call.deck: Night Call is a detective noir story.
call.name: Night Call

call.deck: An open world hunting game.
call.name: theHunter: Call of the Wild

call.deck: Call to 10 is a horror game currently available on Steam.
call.name: Call to 10

call.deck: Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare - Jackal Assault is a PlayStation VR experience that is free to download on PlayStation 4.
call.name: Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare - Jackal Assault

call.deck: A second PlayStation 4 and Xbox One karaoke game in the "Now That's What I Call" series
call.name: Now That's What I Call Sing 2

call.deck: Karaoke game for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One.
call.name: Now That's What I Call Sing

call.deck: A free-to-play adventure game where the player must discover their past through narrative exploration.
call.name: Port of Call

call.deck: Side scrolling action game
call.name: Call of Tomsk-7

call.deck: A third-person adventure influenced by Lovecraft's Cthulhu mythos. As journalist John Parker, players travel to the fishing village of Illsmouth to solve the mystery behind Halley's Comet.
call.name: Call of Cthulhu: Shadow of the Comet

call.deck: An action adventure game inspired by Castlevania and Ghosts'n Goblins.
call.name: Odallus: The Dark Call

call.deck: The eleventh installment of the Call of Duty franchise (and the first spearheaded by Sledgehammer Games) brings modern military thirty years into the future, as new technology (including powered exoskeleton frames and cloaking devices) makes a certain Private Military Corporation the dominant military force of the world.
call.name: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare

call.deck: A free-to-play Call of Duty game released in China.
call.name: Call of Duty Online

call.deck: Call of Duty: Heroes is a 3D combat strategy game for the iOS and Android. You command an army of legendary heroes, elite soldiers and devastating drones in a PvP arena.
call.name: Call of Duty: Heroes

call.deck: A sequel to the original Theatrhythm with more songs, characters, and gameplay modes, including two-player versus.
call.name: Theatrhythm Final Fantasy: Curtain Call

street%20of%20rag.deck: The fifth numbered entry in the renowned Street Fighter series of fighting games has appeared as a PlayStation 4 and PC exclusive.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter V

street%20of%20rag.deck: Play as Kung Fury and uphold the law.
street%20of%20rag.name: Kung Fury: Street Rage

street%20of%20rag.deck: The two leaders in the fighting game genre collide in this ultimate tag-team mash-up. Will you cross the line?
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter X Tekken

street%20of%20rag.deck: A reboot of the FIFA Street series, developed by the core FIFA team at EA Canada.
street%20of%20rag.name: FIFA Street

street%20of%20rag.deck: Play a little cricket with your Move controllers in this PlayStation 3 release.
street%20of%20rag.name: Move Street Cricket

street%20of%20rag.deck: Marking the Itadaki Street board game series's first ever appearance outside of Japan, this Nintendo Wii entry once again challenges classic Dragon Quest characters (as well as Mario and his friends) in real estate.
street%20of%20rag.name: Fortune Street

street%20of%20rag.deck: StreetPass Mii Plaza is a collection of games designed to highlight the StreetPass functionality built into the Nintendo 3DS. Two games (Find Mii & Puzzle Swap) are automatically included while other games are available as DLC.
street%20of%20rag.name: StreetPass Mii Plaza

street%20of%20rag.deck: Super Street Fighter IV is a standalone update to its predecessor, adding new characters, modes, and online features.
street%20of%20rag.name: Super Street Fighter IV

street%20of%20rag.deck: This downloadable seventh iteration of Street Fighter II brings further rebalancing, remixed music, training mode, enhanced online multiplayer, and brand new hand-drawn high-definition graphics.
street%20of%20rag.name: Super Street Fighter II Turbo HD Remix

street%20of%20rag.deck: Released to arcades in 2008 and later ported to consoles, Street Fighter IV updates the venerable series with 3D graphics and a retooled 2D fighting system based on Street Fighter II. Its popularity has sparked renewed interest in the genre, clearing the way for many other successful fighters.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter IV

street%20of%20rag.deck: The 2007 release of the Need for Speed series and the 11th installment of the popular racing game franchise.
street%20of%20rag.name: Need for Speed: ProStreet

street%20of%20rag.deck: Mix-and-match your favorite versions of the Street Fighter II cast to create new dream matches in this special 15th anniversary edition of the arcade classic.
street%20of%20rag.name: Hyper Street Fighter II: The Anniversary Edition

street%20of%20rag.deck: Super Street Fighter II: Turbo Revival is a port of Super Street Fighter II: Turbo released for the Game Boy Advance.
street%20of%20rag.name: Super Street Fighter II: Turbo Revival

street%20of%20rag.deck: Released on the Dreamcast, Street Fighter III: Double Impact is a compilation of the first two Street Fighter III games.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter III: Double Impact

street%20of%20rag.deck: Tekken X Street Fighter is/was one of the two crossover fighting games featuring notable Street Fighter and Tekken characters. This upcoming Namco-developed entry will utilize a 3D playing field featured in the Tekken franchise. Development has been troubled since its announcement.
street%20of%20rag.name: Tekken X Street Fighter

street%20of%20rag.deck: The third and final iteration of Street Fighter III, including a wealth of gameplay and design revisions while introducing several new combatants.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike

street%20of%20rag.deck: Street Sk8ter was the first skateboarding game released for the original Playstation.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Sk8er

street%20of%20rag.deck: The last and largest installment of the Street Fighter Alpha trilogy adds even more characters while adding three unique "fighting styles" (each with special abilities and traits). GO FOR BROKE!
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter Alpha 3

street%20of%20rag.deck: The second iteration of Street Fighter III, updating the original game while adding three new combatants and a new gameplay mechanic ("EX Special Moves").
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter III: 2nd Impact

street%20of%20rag.deck: After numerous iterations of Street Fighter II (and its spin-off Street Fighter Alpha series), Capcom continues its classic fighting game series with a new cast of fighters, a higher-quality graphical style, and revamped gameplay mechanics (introducing the "parry" and "Super Art" systems).
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter III: New Generation

street%20of%20rag.deck: The sequel to (and remake of) Street Fighter Alpha brings five new fighters into the fray including newcomer schoolgirl Sakura while adding a new special ability: the "Custom Combo", in which players can trigger a massive timed combo chain using their Super Meter.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter Alpha 2

street%20of%20rag.deck: Set years before the World Warrior tournament of Street Fighter II, Street Fighter Alpha explores the backstories of some of the series's familiar faces (while introducing new ones) with a revamped fighting game engine (complete with a new cartoony art style).
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter Alpha: Warriors' Dreams

street%20of%20rag.deck: A fighting game based on the 1994 Street Fighter movie, using digitized recordings of the film's actors in place of hand-drawn or computer-drawn sprites.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter: The Movie

street%20of%20rag.deck: Arcade-action 3-on-3 street basketball from Data East for the Neo Geo. Also known as both Dunk Dream and Street Hoop in other territories.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Hoop

street%20of%20rag.deck: The fifth iteration of Street Fighter II makes further changes to each characters' movelist while rebalancing the game and adding a new Super Meter (with a Super Combo attack for each fighter), adjustable game speed settings, and a hidden final boss.
street%20of%20rag.name: Super Street Fighter II Turbo

street%20of%20rag.deck: Four new warriors enter the World Warrior tournament in the fourth main iteration of the classic Street Fighter II series. Along with the roster change, the game received numerous graphical and audio upgrades thanks to its more powerful CPS-2 hardware.
street%20of%20rag.name: Super Street Fighter II

street%20of%20rag.deck: Street Fighter II Champion Edition is a pinball machine based on the Street Fighter franchise.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter II Pinball

street%20of%20rag.deck: The second update to Capcom's signature fighting game, making the gameplay significantly faster while adding new special moves for most characters.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter II' Turbo: Hyper Fighting

street%20of%20rag.deck: The first update to the smash-hit fighting game Street Fighter II balances various aspects of the gameplay while adding support for playable bosses and mirror matches.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter II': Champion Edition

street%20of%20rag.deck: A sci-fi platformer set in futuristic 2010, as a cybernetically-enhanced fighter sets out to defeat a number of mutated superhuman criminals throughout the galaxy. It's notable for its attempted Capcom USA tie-in with the 1987 fighting game Street Fighter.
street%20of%20rag.name: Street Fighter 2010: The Final Fight

street.deck: The fifth numbered entry in the renowned Street Fighter series of fighting games has appeared as a PlayStation 4 and PC exclusive.
street.name: Street Fighter V

secret.deck: Sequel of Uta no Prince-sama All Star, with the follow-up plot, same characters, and new songs.
secret.name: Uta no Prince-sama All Star After Secret

secret.deck: Developed by Funcom, The Secret World is an MMORPG influenced by ancient mythology and legend.
secret.name: The Secret World

secret.deck: Point&Click adventure game.
secret.name: Age of Enigma: The Secret of the Sixth Ghost

secret.deck: My Secret World is part diary, part daily organizer, and can be locked with a PIN for security.
secret.name: My Secret World

secret.deck: Merry Gear Solid: Secret Santa is a parody of Metal Gear Solid.
secret.name: Merry Gear Sol!d: Secret Santa

secret.deck: An educational game in the Adi series.
secret.name: Adiboo & Paziral's Secret

secret.deck: An expansion pack for Battlefield 1942 adding experimental weapons, gadgets and vehicles as well as new maps.
secret.name: Battlefield 1942: Secret Weapons of WWII

secret.deck: A hidden object game.
secret.name: Hidden Objects: Secret Garden

secret.deck: The first game in the legendary Monkey Island series. Guybrush's desire to become a swashbuckling pirate gets him more adventure than he bargained for.
secret.name: The Secret of Monkey Island

secret.deck: 3D remake of Secret of Mana.
secret.name: Secret of Mana

secret.deck: The Big Secret of a Small Town is an adventure game from Flenx
secret.name: The Big Secret of a Small Town

secret.deck: Multiplayer horror game about SCP Foundation.
secret.name: SCP: Secret Laboratory

secret.deck: A visual novel from Soft Circle Courreges.
secret.name: Summer Colored Sisters: Making Secret with Childhood Friends in Midsummer

secret.deck: A visual novel from Hengaya.
secret.name: Because I happened to know a secret of a transforming heroine...
The Secret Story Behind The Development of Super Gravity Humanoid Armaments

secret.deck: A visual novel from NO ACTOR.
secret.name: The School of HypnoApp: Secret Smartphone App That Turns Seniors Into Mamas

secret.deck: Druidstone: The Secret of the Menhir Forest is a fantasy roleplaying game, in which you play the role of a druid who has just been reincarnated. Who are you? How did you die? Your mind is foggy. You only know you are here for a reason. The forest called you here because it needs you.
secret.name: Druidstone: The Secret of Menhir Forest

secret.deck: An adventure game featuring Ary who can summon spheres with their own ecosystems containing different seasons.
secret.name: Ary and the Secret of Seasons

secret.deck: The sixth game in the hidden object series.
secret.name: The Secret Order 6: Bloodline

secret.deck: Secret World Legends is a free to play shared-world RPG, where everything is true.
secret.name: Secret World Legends

secret.deck: A role-playing game from Osanagocoronokimini.
secret.name: My Secret Summer Vacation

secret.deck: Secret in Story
secret.name: Secret in Story

secret.deck: The fifth game in the hidden object series.
secret.name: The Secret Order 5: The Buried Kingdom

secret.deck: The fourth game in the hidden object series.
secret.name: The Secret Order 4: Beyond Time

secret.deck: A World War II themed hidden object game.
secret.name: Agent Walker: Secret Journey

secret.deck: A match-3 game based on the movie.
secret.name: The Secret Life of Pets: Unleashed

secret.deck: A challenging puzzle platformer inspired by Limbo.
secret.name: Toby: The Secret Mine

secret.deck: The Secret Order 2: Masked Intent is a hidden objects game developed and published by Artifex Mundi for PC, Mac, Linux, and iOS platforms
secret.name: The Secret Order 2: Masked Intent

secret.deck: Dead Secret is a single-player mystery thriller designed for VR.
secret.name: Dead Secret

surge.deck: An action RPG set in a dystopian sci-fi future from Deck 13, developers of Lords of the Fallen.
surge.name: The Surge

surge.deck: A new take on the match three genre for PlayStation Mobile.
surge.name: Surge

surge.deck: Enhanced (and color blind friendly) version of FuturLab's block matching game, featuring additional mechanics, a revised scoring system, and a new soundtrack
surge.name: Surge Deluxe

surge.deck: Maximum Surge is a cancelled FMV that was to be released on the Sega Saturn, 3DO, PC, and Mac.
surge.name: Maximum Surge

surge.deck: Feda 2: White Surge the Platoon is the sequel to the turn-based strategy game Feda: The Emblem of Justice. It was released in 1997 only in Japan for the Sony Playstation.
surge.name: Feda 2: White Surge the Platoon

surge.deck: The first entry in GUST's Surge Concerto series.

nba.deck: EA's basketball franchise will make another go of it in 2015.

nba.deck: NBA 2K8 continues a five year legacy as the #1 rated NBA simulation with in-game features that bring basketball to life like never before.
nba.name: NBA 2K8

nba.deck: NBA 2K7 is the eighth installment of the NBA 2K series of realistic basketball games, updating the roster to the 2006/2007 NBA season while improving the online play and adding every athlete's "signature style".

nba.deck: NBA 2K6 is the seventh installment of the NBA 2K series of realistic basketball games, updating the roster to the 2005/2006 NBA season while adding new control mechanics.

nba.name: NBA 2K3

nba.deck: NBA 2K1 is the second installment of the NBA 2K series of realistic basketball games, updating the roster to the 2000/2001 season while adding a new in-depth "franchise mode" and online multiplayer (as well famous street courts and retro teams).

nba.deck: NBA 2K is the first in a series of realistic basketball games (of the same name), bringing a customizable 1999/2000 basketball season to the Dreamcast.

It is also the first game in the series to be released throughout all of Europe and was released in North America nearly ten years later.
dragon ball.name: Dragon Ball Z: Ultimate Battle 22

dragon ball.deck: A unique cinematic-heavy fighting game for the PC Engine that re-tells key battles Goku had throughout the Dragon Ball series.

SPYRO.deck: A New Beginning is the first of the Legend of Spyro trilogy. The dragons are at war with the Malefor. The fate of the dragons lies in the hopes of the prophecy of the purple dragon. Spyro must fight the forces of Malefor and a black dragon named Cynder.

SPYRO.name: Spyro: Season of Ice

Mario.deck: Dr. Mario: Miracle Cure for Nintendo 3DS features various new modes, book-mode style touch screen gameplay and online play.
Mario.name: Dr. Mario: Miracle Cure

Mario.deck: Mario Kart returns and makes its HD-debut with gravity-defying hover vehicles, a new spin on the traditional track designs, ATVs, the return of classic Last Man Standing-Battle Mode, custom online tournaments and Mario Kart TV, which allows for sharing of highlight videos online.
Mario.name: Mario Kart 8

Mario.deck: The fourth entry in the Mario and Luigi RPG series has Mario traversing dreams within Luigi's mind. Players will have to interact with Luigi on the bottom screen to provoke certain events within his dreams.
Mario.name: Mario & Luigi: Dream Team

Mario.deck: Minis on the Move is the first entry of the puzzle-oriented Mario vs DK series on the Nintendo 3DS.
Mario.name: Mario and Donkey Kong: Minis on the Move

Mario.deck: A free expanded version of the AR-app on the Nintendo 3DS available on the eShop.
Mario.name: Photos with Mario

Mario.deck: The third and latest entry in the Namco Bandai-developed Mario Kart Arcade franchise, released exclusively in Japan.
Mario.name: Mario Kart: Arcade GP DX

Mario.deck: A handheld RPG and the fourth in the Paper Mario series. Along with the signature papercraft aesthetic, the game uses stickers as a core mechanic in both story and gameplay.
Mario.name: Paper Mario: Sticker Star

Mario.deck: Mario, Luigi and the rest of the cast return for their HD debut in New Super Mario Bros. U with support for five players in boost mode, a Super Mario World-style world map with secret shortcuts and hidden levels, a brand new challenge mode and Miiverse integration.
Mario.name: New Super Mario Bros. U

Mario.deck: Mario Tennis Open for the 3DS is the sixth game in the Mario Tennis series. It was announced during Nintendo's pre-TGS Media Briefing on September 12, 2011.
Mario.name: Mario Tennis Open

Mario.deck: The first stereoscopic 3D edition of the premiere Kart Racing series starring Nintendo's famous mascots and the seventh home release in the franchise (ninth overall). It has a new first-person mode and kart customizations.
Mario.name: Mario Kart 7

Mario.deck: Super Mario 3D Land blends elements of 2D and 3D Mario platformers, making it distinct from both parts of the franchise.
Mario.name: Super Mario 3D Land

Mario.deck: Control a cadre of Mario miniatures to battle Mario's nemesis, Donkey Kong. It's more focused on creating a path this time.
Mario.name: Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Mini-Land Mayhem

Mario.deck: The first Mario sequel in over 15 years to appear on the same console as its predecessor, Mario is back in the galactic platforming game, joined by Yoshi as he explores additional planets with new mechanics, power-ups, and boss battles.
Mario.name: Super Mario Galaxy 2

Mario.deck: Mario & Sonic go head to head once again in Vancouver. They participate in a variety of winter themed events & some brand new Dream events.
Mario.name: Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Winter Games

Mario.deck: Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story is the third installment in the whimsical Mario & Luigi franchise by AlphaDream & Nintendo. Mario and Luigi must save the Mushroom Kingdom from the evil doings of Fawful, with the unknowing help of King Bowser.
Mario.name: Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story

Mario.deck: The third game in the Mario vs. Donkey Kong series and a DSiWare exclusive, featuring puzzle-based platforming similar to the Lemmings games.
Mario.name: Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Minis March Again!

Mario.deck: DSi edition of DR. Mario.
Mario.name: Dr. Mario Express

Mario.deck: Fill your prescription with this WiiWare update of Nintendo's pill-popping puzzle game.
Mario.name: Dr. Mario Online RX

Mario.deck: In Mario's first Wii adventure, the famed plumber travels throughout the universe on his latest quest to save Princess Peach from the evil Bowser.
Mario.name: Super Mario Galaxy

Mario.deck: Developed by Next Level Games for Nintendo, Mario Strikers Charged is a football game involving classic Nintendo characters released for the Wii. It also introduces online play into the Mario Strikers series.
Mario.name: Mario Strikers Charged

Mario.deck: The second arcade Mario Kart title. Both Waluigi and Mametchi join the roster in this racer.
Mario.name: Mario Kart Arcade GP 2

Mario.deck: Mario Hoops is a basketball game developed by Square Enix featuring characters from the Mario franchise as well as some traditional Final Fantasy class types and creatures.
Mario.name: Mario Hoops 3 on 3

Mario.deck: Partners in Time is the second in the Mario & Luigi series. In this game, Mario, Luigi, Baby Mario, and Baby Luigi travel back and forth through time to save the Mushroom Kingdom. It features a battle engine similar to that of Paper Mario.
Mario.name: Mario & Luigi: Partners in Time

Mario.deck: Mario takes it to the soccer field in Super Mario Strikers. Use Koopa shells and Super Strikes to crush your opponent! (Literally.)
Mario.name: Super Mario Strikers

tomb raider.deck: A young and inexperienced Lara Croft is shipwrecked on a mysterious island in this reboot of the beloved action adventure franchise, which departs from the mood of prior games in the series.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider

tomb raider.deck: Tomb Raider stars Lara Croft in her first title as she races through the jungles of Peru to the sands of Egypt in pursuit of the Scion, an ancient artifact reputedly holding the key to the ancient mystery of Atlantis itself. It would later be remade as Tomb Raider Anniversary.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider

tomb raider.deck: The first handheld Tomb Raider game.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider

tomb raider.deck: With an improved graphics engine, Lara Croft is back and is looking better than ever. This time around she'll be going on an adventure to find the sacred Mayan underworld of Xibalba in Southern Mexico.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider: Underworld

tomb raider.deck: Anniversary is a remake of the original Tomb Raider game, running in the engine from Tomb Raider: Legend. Join Lara Croft as she travels the world on her very first adventure all over again!
tomb raider.name: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: Anniversary

tomb raider.deck: Lara travels across the world in search of a legendary artifact. Legend is the first entry in the 2006 reboot of the series and is the first Tomb Raider game developed by Crystal Dynamics after they took over the role from Core Design.
tomb raider.name: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: Legend

tomb raider.deck: The Angel of Darkness is the sixth game in the Tomb Raider series, and the first for the PlayStation 2. It features a lot of design differences and is widely considered the weakest game in the series.
tomb raider.name: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Angel of Darkness

tomb raider.deck: The fifth entry in the popular Tomb Raider series delves into Lara's past to reveal some of her previously unwitnessed adventuring exploits.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider: Chronicles

tomb raider.deck: When Lara Croft accidentally releases the Egyptian god Set, she must quickly find a way to entomb him once again before he unleashes the apocalypse.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider: The Last Revelation

tomb raider.deck: The third game in the Tomb Raider series. Lara travels the world to find four meteorite stones.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider III: Adventures of Lara Croft

tomb raider.deck: The second title in the Tomb Raider franchise. Lara Croft races against the forces of Marco Bartoli in search of clues that will lead her to the Dagger of Xian, a powerful relic that allowed the Emperor of China to command his armies.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider II

tomb raider.deck: The third game in Lara's rebooted series
tomb raider.name: Shadow of the Tomb Raider

tomb raider.deck: A four-player, light-gun shooter game created to coincide with the 2018 film reboot of Tomb Raider.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider Arcade

tomb raider.deck: A follow up to 2013's Tomb Raider reboot. After the events of the previous game, Lara spends one year searching to explain what she saw. Her quest to explain immortality leads her to Siberia, home of a mythical city known as Kitezh.
tomb raider.name: Rise of the Tomb Raider

tomb raider.deck: A HD re-release of Legend, Anniversary, and Underworld on the PS3.
tomb raider.name: The Tomb Raider Trilogy

tomb raider.deck: Ubisoft and Eidos team up to release this two game cartridge featuring their respective adventure games.
tomb raider.name: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time & Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Prophecy
Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Prophecy
Lara Croft Tomb Raider: Curse of the Sword

tomb raider.deck: A short standalone sequel to Tomb Raider III released for PC and Mac.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider: The Lost Artifact

tomb raider.deck: The game takes place in Egypt, and occurs several months after the events of Tomb Raider. The story sees Lara returning to the City of Khamoon to investigate a mysterious statue of the Egyptian goddess Bast.
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider: Unfinished Business

tomb raider.deck: The story involves Lara Croft coming across some clues referring to a small island in the Bering Sea: a faded photograph showing an Inuit whale hunter holding what looks like an ancient Golden Mask, an old newspaper from 1945 referring to a conflict over an Alaskan gold discovery, and a secret kind of fortified military mine base. Lara is primarily interested in finding the Mask, as it is rumoured to be the famed Golden Mask of Tornarsuk - a greater spirit said to bestow powers of re-animation on the mask w
tomb raider.name: Tomb Raider: The Golden Mask
